statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Valparaiso 80, Charlotte 77
article.story: CHARLOTTE, N.C. (AP) -- Seth Colclasure scored a team-high 24 points and hit all four of his 3-pointers to lead Valparaiso past Charlotte 80-77 on Saturday. Dan Oppland scored 19 and Mohamed Kone added 14 for the Crusaders (4-2), who remain a perfect 4-0 on the 49ers' home court. The win snapped a two-game losing streak. Valparaiso twice led by as many as 15, the last time going up 54-39 with 15:39 remaining. Charlotte (5-4), which ended a four-game winning streak, fought back with a 12-0 run to trim the deficit to three with 9:39 to go. The 49ers twice managed to take the lead late in the game, the final time going up 67-65 with 5:18 to play on a 3-pointer by De'Angelo Alexander, who finished with a career high 32 points. Valparaiso closed the game outscoring Charlotte 15-10, connecting on all eight of its free throws. "Seth is very secure with the basketball," said Valparaiso coach Homer Drew. "He has a great IQ for basketball. What he doesn't have in speed and jumping ability, he makes up with the intelligence factor." Charlotte got off to a quick start in the first half, running out to a 14-5 lead before the five-minute mark. The Crusaders roared back, outscoring the 49ers 32-8 over the next 11:37 to take a 37-22 lead with 3:10 remaining in the half. Oppland and Colclasure each scored seven during Valparaiso's run. The 49ers, which had 12 turnovers in the half, answered with three consecutive 3-pointers to trail 40-31 at halftime. "We need to execute better, defensively especially," said Charlotte coach Bobby Lutz. "We had made such strides but tonight we didn't have it. "When we stopped scoring, we didn't execute defensively and missed assignments. You're going to give up baskets, but we gave up 22 points in the paint in the first half. We can't do that."
